get.summary: Gets a recipe of the Day
get.description: This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the recipe of the day from the Foodoscope database. The response will be in JSON format with a 200 status code. The response will include various details about the recipe such as its ID, title, nutritional information, cooking and preparation time, servings, URL, region, continent, source etc.

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve details of a specific recipe identified by the recipe ID. The response will have a status code of 200 and a JSON payload containing various details of the recipe, including its ID, nutritional information, cooking and preparation times, servings, title, URL, region, sub-region, continent, source, image URL, utensils etc.

instructions: Cook and stir the curry powder and curry paste in a saucepan over medium low heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Pour the coconut milk into the saucepan and mix well.
Stir in the fish sauce, brown sugar, and 1 cup chicken stock.
Place the chicken thighs, peas, peppers, and carrots into the saucepan with the curry sauce.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium high heat, then reduce the heat to low.
Simmer until the chicken is cooked though, about 25 minutes.
Whisk together 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of cold chicken stock.
Stir cornstarch mixture into the curry.
Mix the pineapple into the curry and cook until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.

get.description: This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipes based on the specified region. The request includes a searchText parameter for filtering recipes by region, and a pageSize parameter to limit the number of results per page. The response contains a success message, a payload object with recipe data, and various nutritional information for each recipe. The recipe data includes details such as index, ID, cook time, prep time, title, URL, servings, source, image URL etc.

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipes based on the specified sub-region. The request includes a searchText parameter for filtering recipes by subregion, and a pageSize parameter to limit the number of results per page. The response contains a success message, a payload object with recipe data, and various nutritional information for each recipe. The recipe data includes details such as index, ID, cook time, prep time, title, URL, servings, source, image URL etc.

data.Recipe_title: Sugared Danish Butter Cookies with Pecan Halves

get.description: This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipes based on the specified continent. The request includes a searchText parameter for filtering recipes by continent, and a pageSize parameter to limit the number of results per page. The response contains a success message, a payload object with recipe data, and various nutritional information for each recipe. The recipe data includes details such as index, ID, cook time, prep time, title, URL, servings, source, image URL etc.

get.summary: Search in recipe's table or by recipe title
get.description: This endpoint performs an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipe search results from the Foodoscope API. The request includes parameters for searchText, page, and pageSize to filter and paginate the results. The response returns a status code of 200 and a JSON object with a success message, a payload containing an array of recipe data, and a totalCount field indicating the total number of recipes available.

get.summary: Gets a recipe by searching ingredients used
get.description: This API endpoint allows users to search for ingredients in the Foodoscope database. By making an HTTP GET request to the specified URL, users can search for recipes based on ingredients and set the pageSize for the number of results to be returned.

This API endpoint allows users to search for categories in the Foodoscope database. By making an HTTP GET request to the specified URL, users can search for recipes based on ingredients(eg Fruit, Dairy etc) and set the pageSize for the number of results to be returned.

get.summary: Gets a recipe by Cooking Processes
get.description: This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipes based on processes (eg bake, fry etc) and page size. The response will be in JSON format and will include fields such as Recipe_index, Recipe_id, cook_time, prep_time, Recipe_title, url, servings, Source, img_url, and a wide range of nutritional information for each recipe.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve recipes based on the utensils provided in the query parameter. The response contains an array of recipe data including details such as cook time, prep time, servings, nutritional information, and more.

post.summary: Advanced recipe search with multiple filters
post.description: Allows advanced searching of recipes based on multiple criteria including ingredients, nutritional information, and more. The response is an array of all the recipies which match with the criteria

Allows filtering of recipes based on nutritional values such as energy, carbohydrates, fat, and protein. Note: If you are providing a max value for energy, you must provide a min value for energy too. Similar for other pairs of min-max values.

200.description: Successful operation, returns recipes matching the nutritional criteria.

post.description: Allows searching for recipes by specifying ingredients used or not used.

200.description: Successful operation, returns recipes that match the ingredient criteria.

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: For accessing the API, a valid JWT token must be passed in all queries in the 'Authorization' header. The token must be prefixed by the word 'Bearer' followed by a space. The token is generated by the API. Here is an example of how the Authorization header should appear: Bearer <API_KEY>
